businessSummary.oneLiner: The world's largest publicly traded Ethereum (ETH) holder, applying MicroStrategy's Bitcoin playbook to Ethereum as a digital asset treasury company.
businessSummary.description: Originally a Bitcoin mining equipment and hosting company, Bitmine pivoted to an Ethereum treasury strategy after Tom Lee (Fundstrat co-founder) joined as chairman in June 2025. The core business model is raising capital through equity and convertible note offerings to acquire ETH. The company now holds approximately 4.37 million ETH (3.62% of total supply), making it the world's largest publicly listed ETH holder. On 2/21, it added another 17,722 ETH ($34.74M), bringing the weekly total to an aggressive 62,722 ETH ($123.25M). Institutional accumulation continues with Morgan Stanley (12.1M shares), ARK Invest (9.4M shares), BlackRock (+166%), Goldman Sachs (+588%), and Stevens Capital initiating a new position on 2/21.
howTheyMakeMoney: Appreciation in ETH holdings (4.37M ETH, ~$8.7B at ETH $1,989)
Staking revenue via the MAVAN network , ~$176-252M annually (3.04M ETH staked at 2.89% yield, $176M already realized)
Legacy BTC consulting and equipment leasing (~$2.3M quarterly revenue)
Strategic investments (Beast Industries/MrBeast $200M investment and other 'moonshot' portfolio positions)
keyProducts: Ethereum Treasury (4.37M ETH, total crypto + cash holdings of $9.6B as of 2/16 filing)
MAVAN (Made-in-America Validator Network) staking infrastructure , targeting full operation in Q1 2026
Strategic investment portfolio (Beast Industries $200M, Eightco Holdings $17M, etc.)
BTC ecosystem services (consulting, equipment leasing, 193 BTC held)

keyMetrics.name: P/E Ratio
keyMetrics.interpretation: FY25 GAAP EPS of +$13.39 reflects ETH mark-to-market gains. However, unrealized losses from ETH price declines create extreme volatility. P/NAV is a more appropriate valuation metric than traditional P/E.

keyMetrics.name: Price/NAV (P/B Ratio)
keyMetrics.interpretation: Trading at a roughly 20% discount to book value. Deeply undervalued versus the sector median of 3.64x.

keyMetrics.name: Revenue Growth (YoY)
keyMetrics.interpretation: TTM revenue of $7.19M remains small but is growing rapidly as staking income ramps up. FY2026E consensus revenue of $193.4M (+3,073% YoY) reflects MAVAN launch impact.

keyMetrics.name: ETH Holdings
keyMetrics.value: 4,371,497 ETH ($8.69B at ETH $1,989, 3.62% of total supply)
keyMetrics.interpretation: 72% of the way toward the 'Alchemy of 5%' target (5% of total supply). Holds 5x more than #2 SharpLink Gaming (863K ETH).

keyMetrics.name: Debt-to-Equity
keyMetrics.interpretation: Leverage primarily through convertible notes. Cash position of $888M (mrq) provides adequate short-term liquidity, but further ETH declines could increase funding pressure.

keyMetrics.name: Free Cash Flow
keyMetrics.interpretation: Ongoing cash burn from ETH acquisitions, though $176M/year in staking revenue is gradually improving operating cash flow.

keyMetrics.name: FY26 Revenue Consensus
keyMetrics.interpretation: Reflects MAVAN staking infrastructure at full capacity and surging staking income. FY27E $506.7M (+162% YoY) if scaling continues as projected.

growthDrivers.title: Massive institutional buying , Morgan Stanley, ARK, BlackRock, and Goldman Sachs among top holders
growthDrivers.description: Morgan Stanley holds 12.1M shares (Q4 +26%, $331M), ARK Invest 9.4M shares (Q4 +27%, $256M), BlackRock +166%, Goldman Sachs +588%, BofA +1,668%. A total of 419 institutions hold 152M shares. Stevens Capital also initiated a new position on 2/21.

growthDrivers.title: MAVAN staking going fully operational in Q1 2026 , projected $252-480M annual revenue
growthDrivers.description: Currently staking 3.04M ETH (69% of holdings) with 3 pilot partners, already generating $176M annually at 2.89% yield. MAVAN's proprietary validator network targets $252M upon Q1 2026 launch, scaling to $480M at full capacity.

growthDrivers.title: Tom Lee: 'Sentiment mirrors 2018 and 2022 bottoms' , crypto winter trough signal
growthDrivers.description: BMNR Chairman and Fundstrat co-founder Tom Lee says current investor sentiment matches November 2022 and 2018 crypto winter lows, justifying continued accumulation. The company purchased 62,722 ETH ($123M) in just one week, a new weekly record.

growthDrivers.title: ETH testing $2,000 resistance , breakout would trigger sharp NAV revaluation
growthDrivers.description: ETH at $1,989 (as of 2/22) is testing the $2,000 resistance level. With 4.37M ETH, every $1 increase in ETH adds $4.37M to NAV. Charts show a falling wedge pattern forming, with next resistance at $35 on a breakout.

competitiveAdvantage.summary: Dominant #1 position in the Ethereum treasury space. A 5x lead over the nearest competitor and Tom Lee's Wall Street network form the core competitive advantages.

moats.description: 4.37M ETH , 5x more than #2 SharpLink Gaming (863K ETH) and 8.8x more than #3 The Ether Machine (497K ETH). Controls 3.62% of total Ethereum supply.
Chairman Tom Lee brings 30 years of Wall Street experience and connections. Morgan Stanley, BlackRock, ARK Invest, Goldman Sachs, Vanguard, and BofA are all shareholders.
Secured the 'MicroStrategy of Ethereum' positioning early. First major publicly listed crypto company to declare a dividend, enhancing institutional appeal.
Building the first large-scale U.S.-based ETH validator network. Evolving beyond passive holding to a revenue-generating infrastructure capable of $176-480M annually.

competitors.name: SharpLink Gaming (SBET)
competitors.detail: 863K ETH held, #2 ETH treasury. One-fifth the scale of BMNR.

competitors.name: Strategy (MSTR)
competitors.detail: $59B BTC treasury. The Bitcoin version of the same playbook. No staking revenue.

competitors.name: Coinbase (COIN)
competitors.detail: 137K ETH held, primarily an exchange platform rather than a treasury company.

recentNews.headline: Bitmine adds 17,722 ETH ($34.74M), bringing weekly total to a record 62,722 ETH ($123M)
recentNews.significance: Purchased 17,722 ETH on 2/21 alone, accumulating 62,722 ETH ($123M) for the week in an aggressive buying spree , a new weekly acquisition record. Funds transferred from Kraken hot wallet to three separate wallets.

recentNews.headline: Stevens Capital Management opens new BMNR position , 42,563 shares
recentNews.significance: Another institutional investor initiates a BMNR position, following all top 11 shareholders increasing Q4 stakes.

recentNews.headline: BanklessTimes: 'Top reasons why BMNR could go parabolic' , comprehensive bull case analysis
recentNews.significance: Major crypto media outlet provides a systematic bullish thesis covering institutional accumulation, MAVAN, and NAV discount. Identifies falling wedge pattern, bullish PPO crossover, and next resistance at $35.

recentNews.headline: Tom Lee: 'Crypto sentiment matches 2018 and 2022 bottoms' , buys $90M in ETH
recentNews.significance: Chairman Tom Lee draws parallels between current crypto sentiment and historic market bottoms, citing deleveraging rather than structural failures. The weekly 45,759 ETH purchase set a new single-week record at the time.

recentNews.headline: Official filing: ETH holdings reach 4,371,497 , total crypto + cash $9.6B, 3.04M ETH staked
recentNews.significance: Latest official holdings disclosure (as of 2/16). 4.37M ETH ($8.73B), 193 BTC, and $670M in cash. Total assets $9.6B.

recentNews.headline: Yahoo Finance: 'BMNR falls despite ETH purchases , $15 support at risk'
recentNews.significance: Stock continued declining even as 35,000 ETH were added to treasury, highlighting the NAV decoupling problem. Bollinger Band lower bound at $15.79 flags technical pressure on the $15-$17 support zone.

analystOpinions.notableComment: All 3 covering analysts rate Buy or Strong Buy. B. Riley (Fedor Shabalin) targets $47, reduced from $90 in November 2025, while maintaining Strong Buy. Cantor Fitzgerald rates Overweight at $39. Consensus target of $43 implies 114% upside from the current $20.13. FY2026E revenue $193.4M (+3,073%), EPS $0.35. Note: very thin coverage at just 3 analysts.

risks.title: Further ETH downside risk , average cost basis ~$3,826 vs. current price of $1,989, a ~48% unrealized loss
risks.description: ETH trades at $1,989 (as of 2/22), roughly 48% below the average acquisition price of $3,826, translating to approximately $6B in unrealized losses. A break of the $15-$17 technical support zone could trigger further acceleration lower.

risks.title: Severe shareholder dilution , stock down 87% from 52-week high of $161
risks.description: Shares have fallen from a 52-week high of $161 (June 2025) to $20.13, an 87% decline. A $315.24M shelf registration tied to an ESOP offering adds further dilution pressure on top of ongoing convertible note issuances.

risks.title: NAV decoupling , stock falls even as ETH purchases continue, reflecting market skepticism
risks.description: Despite a record 62,722 ETH ($123M) purchased this week, the stock remains flat to declining. All rally attempts face a dense $23-$32 EMA cluster acting as a ceiling, signaling the market distrusts the strategy.

risks.title: Trading below all major moving averages , severe technical weakness
risks.description: Both the 50-day SMA ($27) and 200-day SMA ($32) sit well above the current price of $20.13. Technical scoring is 1 buy signal vs. 11 sell signals. The lower Bollinger Band at $15.79 signals proximity to critical support.

risks.title: Regulatory and management risk , SEC ETH classification and staking regulation uncertainty
risks.description: The potential for the SEC to classify ETH as a security and tightened staking regulations remain ongoing risks. Any MAVAN launch delay would impair the revenue model underpinning the bull case.

buyReasons.title: Trading at a discount to NAV while 419 institutions are betting on a bottom
buyReasons.rationale: Roughly 20% discount to book value (P/B 0.80x). Morgan Stanley, ARK, BlackRock, Goldman Sachs, BofA, and Stevens Capital are all adding to positions. 419 institutions collectively hold 152M shares.

buyReasons.title: MAVAN staking revenue materializing , transitioning from passive holder to income-generating enterprise
buyReasons.rationale: Currently staking 3.04M ETH, already generating $176M annually. MAVAN launch in Q1 2026 could scale to $252M, with full capacity at $480M. FY2026E consensus revenue sits at $193.4M (+3,073% YoY). This income stream is a key differentiator that BTC treasury companies cannot replicate.

buyReasons.title: ETH breakout above $2,000 would trigger leveraged upside , the power of 4.37M ETH
buyReasons.rationale: With 4.37M ETH, a $100 increase in ETH price adds $437M in asset value. Tom Lee views current sentiment as analogous to the 2018 and 2022 market bottoms. A falling wedge breakout targets $35 as the next technical resistance.

overallOpinion: Holds 4.37M ETH ($8.7B) at a ~20% discount to NAV , 419 institutional investors are betting on a bottom
ETH average cost basis ($3,826) is 48% above current price; 50-day SMA ($27) and 200-day SMA ($32) both acting as overhead resistance, with $15-$17 support at risk
MAVAN staking launch in Q1 targets $252M annual revenue and FY2026E consensus of $193.4M (+3,073%), a key differentiator versus BTC treasury peers
Persistent share dilution ($315M shelf registration) and NAV decoupling remain the most significant structural risks
ETH reclaiming $2,000 is the near-term pivotal variable , approach as a high-risk position sized at 5% of portfolio or less
